result.title: Core Contributions of Spatial and Temporal Adaptation in Machine Learning-Based Scheduling Knowledge Acquisition
result.introduction: In machine learning-based scheduling knowledge acquisition, traditional research has focused on temporal adaptation, which involves acquiring knowledge to determine effective dispatching rules for system states that change over time. This study introduces and explores the concepts of spatial adaptation and spatial-temporal adaptation to enhance system productivity and knowledge acquisition.
result.main_body:
Temporal adaptation primarily contributes by enabling the acquisition of knowledge for determining effective dispatching rules that adapt to system states as they evolve over time. This addresses the dynamic nature of production systems.

Spatial adaptation, a novel concept introduced in this research, contributes by allowing each machine to consider not only its own situation but also the dispatching rules of surrounding machines to find the optimal dispatching rule. This leads to a more holistic and coordinated approach to scheduling.

The combination of these, spatial-temporal adaptation, is proposed as a strategy to optimize system productivity by adapting to both spatial and temporal variations. The study proposes two methods for knowledge acquisition: a systematic experimental design using the Taguchi method and a coevolutionary genetic algorithm.

Experimental applications demonstrated that spatial adaptation using the Taguchi method yielded better performance and robustness to various noise conditions compared to well-known heuristic rules, particularly in stable systems like semiconductor fabrication. For more dynamic systems, extending the Taguchi method to spatial-temporal adaptation further improved system performance by adapting to fluctuations in system states, generating enhanced strategies over spatial adaptation alone.

Furthermore, the development of a coevolutionary genetic algorithm for both spatial and spatial-temporal adaptation significantly contributed to reducing the learning time while achieving satisfactory results. This method was shown to obtain better solutions more quickly than the Taguchi method, although the Taguchi approach provided educational insights into decision-making processes for human experts, which is beneficial for automated knowledge extraction.
result.conclusion: The core contributions of spatial and temporal adaptation techniques in machine learning-based scheduling knowledge acquisition are the development of strategies that adapt to both the changing states of a system over time (temporal adaptation) and the interactive context of machines within a system (spatial adaptation). These techniques, especially when combined into spatial-temporal adaptation and implemented with methods like coevolutionary genetic algorithms, lead to improved system performance, robustness, and more efficient knowledge acquisition for optimizing scheduling in complex production environments.

평가에서의 심한 변동 (high variability)과 이웃하는 집단간의 파동효과 (ripple effects)에 의해 일반적으로 공진화 과정은 방해를 받게 된다. 이러한 문제들을 극복하기 위해 새로운 평가 방법 (evaluation method)을 개발하였고, 그러한 문제를 경감시키는데 효과적임이 증명되었다. 제안한 방법에서, 집단 내의 각 개체 (individual)는 시스템 수행도의 1계 변동(first-order change)에서의 역할에 따라 책임을 지게 된다. 각 개체의 적합도 (fitness)는 그 개체의 0계 수행도 (zero-order performance)와 1계 수행도 (first-order performance)의 함수로서 결정된다. 공간적응과 공간-시간적응 모두에서 공진화 유전자 알고리듬을 이용한 접근이 다구치 방법보다 좋은 해를 빨리 얻을 수 있었다. 공진화 유전자 알고리듬과 다구치 방법을 학습에 소요되는 시간과 해 (solution)의 질적인 측면에서 비교하였다. 두 방법 중 공진화 유전자 알고리듬이 확실히 짧은 시간 내에 학습을 하였다. 다구치 방법은 충분한 시간과 노력을 들여야만 공진화 유전자 알고리듬 정도의 해를 얻을 수 있다. 그러나, 다구치 접근을 적용하면서 알게 되는 의사결정과정은 인간 전문가에게 교육적이다. 그래서 스케줄링 전문지식을 분석하고 축적하기 위한 자동화된 지식 추출을 위해서는 더욱 유익하다.
